midas/examples/lowlevel/rpc_test.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         rpc_test.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     Mini RPC client for testing purposes
00007 
00008                 This program connects to a server running the MIDAS
00009                 main server. It calles the routine rpc_test on this
00010                 server, which simply doubles some arguments. By
00011                 receiving the proper results, one can check that the
00012                 parameter passing via MIDAS RPCs works correctly.
00013 
00014   $Log: rpc_test.c,v $
00015   Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/20 23:37:11  mucap
00016   Importing release 1.9.5 of the MIDAS source code as distributed by PSI.
00017   (Next, I'll commit our local customizations.)
00018 
00019   Revision 1.3  2004/01/08 08:40:09  midas
00020   Implemented standard indentation
00021 
00022   Revision 1.2  1998/10/12 12:18:59  midas
00023   Added Log tag in header
00024 
00025 
00026 \********************************************************************/
00027 
00028 #include "midas.h"
00029 #include "mrpc.h"
00030 #include <stdio.h>
00031 
00032 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00033 
00034 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00035 rpc_test(char *ahost_name)
00036 #else
00037 main()
00038 #endif
00039 {
00040    char host_name[256];
00041    INT status;
00042    BYTE b;
00043    WORD w;
00044    INT i;
00045    float f;
00046    double d;
00047 
00048 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00049    strcpy(host_name, ahost_name);
00050 #else
00051    printf("Remote host IP address: ");
00052    ss_gets(host_name, 256);
00053 #endif
00054 
00055    status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, "", "RPC_TEST", NULL);
00056    if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
00057       return 1;
00058 
00059    f = 3.5f;
00060    d = 4.5;
00061 
00062    /* rpc_test just doubles numbers */
00063    rpc_call(RPC_TEST, 1, 2, 3l, f, d, &b, &w, &i, &f, &d);
00064 
00065    printf("\nResult should be:  2 4 6 7.0 9.0\n");
00066    printf("Result is:         %d %d %ld %1.1f %1.1lf\n", b, w, i, f, d);
00067 
00068    printf("\nhit return...");
00069    b = getchar();
00070 
00071    cm_disconnect_experiment();
00072    return 1;
00073 }
